intro: Cheiridopsis pressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant has small, sparsely arranged leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its hardy nature, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
